title: Requires at least two qualified individuals to be present supervising a public or school pool when instructional activity is taking place
summary: Requires the sanitary code shall be amended to provide at least two qualified individuals to be present supervising a public or school pool when instructional activity is taking place.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2642

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 19, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A. GABRYSZAK, CASTRO, LANCMAN, ABBATE, ROBINSON,
         PERRY -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M.  of  A.  BOYLAND,  BURLING,  MAISEL,
         MAYERSOHN, McDONOUGH, SCHIMEL, WEISENBERG -- read once and referred to
         the Committee on Health

       AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to requiring at least
         two qualified individuals to be present supervising a public or school
         pool when instructional activity is taking place

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 225 of the public health law is amended by adding a
    2  new subdivision 5-d to read as follows:
    3    5-D. THE SANITARY CODE SHALL PROVIDE THAT  WHEN  INSTRUCTIONAL  ACTIV-
    4  ITIES ARE TAKING PLACE AT A PUBLIC OR SCHOOL SWIMMING POOL, AT LEAST TWO
    5  POOL STAFF MEMBERS MEETING AT LEAST SUPERVISION LEVEL III SHALL BE PRES-
    6  ENT.
    7    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07595-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to requiring at least two qualified individuals to be present supervising a public or school pool when instructional activity is taking place
